01_data_basics/01_counting/02_list_counting_between_v1

A random procedure generated the following sample (sequence of measurements):

\[\mathbf{x} = 94, 97, 91, 92, 97, 92, 93, 91, 95, 95 \]

You can download the data as a CSV file (for importing into a spreadsheet or R): list_counting_between_data.csv


  1. How many of the measurements are inside 95.5 to 99.5? In other words, determine \(\#[\mathbf{x}>95.5\texttt{ AND } \mathbf{x}<99.5]\). In other words, determine \(\#[95.5<\mathbf{x}<99.5]\).
  2. How many of the measurements are outside 96.5 to 99.5? In other words, determine \(\#[\mathbf{x}<96.5\texttt{ OR } \mathbf{x}>99.5]\). In other words, determine \(\#[\texttt{NOT}(96.5<\mathbf{x}<99.5)]\).
  3. How many of the measurements are closer than 2 units from 96.5? In other words, determine \(\#\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-96.5\big|<2\right]\).
  4. How many of the measurements are farther than 2 units from 96.5? In other words, determine \(\#\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-96.5\big|>2\right]\).
  5. Determine an integer radius \(r\) of an interval with center 96.5 such that \(\#\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-96.5\big|<r\right] ~=~ 4\).
  6. Determine a half-integer radius \(r\) of an interval with center 93 such that \(\#\left[\big|\mathbf{x}-93\big|>r\right] ~=~ 6\).
